greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: G.f.: Sum_{n>=0} x^n*Sum_{k=0..n} (-1)^k * C(n,k)^2 * Sum_{j=0..k} C(k,j)^2 * x^j.
comment: The g.f.s formed from a(2*n)^(1/2) and (-a(2*n+1)/3)^(1/2) are:
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..500
A. Bostan, S. Boukraa, J.-M. Maillard, and J.-A. Weil, Diagonals of rational functions and selected differential Galois groups, arXiv preprint arXiv:1507.03227 [math-ph], 2015.
formula: G.f.: 1 / AGM(1-x^2, sqrt(1+14*x^2+x^4)), where AGM(x,y) = AGM((x+y)/2, sqrt(x*y)) is the arithmetic-geometric mean.
a(n) = (-1)^n*Sum_{k=0..n} binomial(2*(n-k), n-k)*binomial(2*n-k, k)^2. - _Peter Luschny_, Aug 17 2014
a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} (-1)^k * C(2*k, k)^2 * C(n+k, n-k). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Aug 17 2014
example: where the g.f. is given by the binomial series:
in which the coefficients of odd powers of x vanish.
We can also express the g.f. by the binomial series identity:
maple: A245925 := n -> (-1)^n*add(binomial(2*(n-k), n-k)*binomial(2*n-k, k)^2, k=0..n); seq(A245925(n), n=0..20); # _Peter Luschny_, Aug 17 2014
mathematica: Table[Sum[Sum[(-1)^(j+k) * Binomial[2*n - k, j + k]^2 * Binomial[j + k, k]^2, {j, 0, 2*n - 2*k}], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 20}] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 16 2014 after _Paul D. Hanna_ *)
program: {a(n)=polcoeff(sum(m=0, n, x^m*sum(k=0, m, (-1)^k*binomial(m, k)^2*sum(j=0, k, binomial(k, j)^2*x^j)+x*O(x^n))), n)}
(PARI) /* From formula for a(n); printing only nonzero terms: */
(PARI) /* Formula for a(n), after _Peter Luschny_ and _Robert Israel_: */
{a(n) = sum(k=0, n, (-1)^k * binomial(2*k, k)^2 * binomial(n+k, n-k) )}
A245925 = lambda n: (-1)^n*sum(binomial(2*(n-k), n-k)*binomial(2*n-k, k)^2 for k in (0..n))
[A245925(n) for n in range(21)] # _Peter Luschny_, Aug 17 2014
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Aug 15 2014
